Bateman Rewarded For Stellar Debut With UCHC Goalie of the Week Award - Elmira College Athletics

Holderness Bulls
November 13, 2019 at 11:58 AM ·

"In the first edition of the United Collegiate Hockey Conference's (UCHC) weekly awards on Tuesday, Elmira College freshman" and Holderness Alumnus "Logan Bateman '17 was tabbed the Goalie of the Week.

Bateman was recognized by the conference following a tremendous debut performance against No. 5 nationally-ranked Hobart College on Saturday. After the Statesmen scored five the night prior, Bateman limited them to just a single goal on their home ice in Geneva, New York, as the two sides skated to a 1-1 overtime draw. The first-year netminder from Ottawa, Ontario, stood on his head and made 47 saves, the most by an EC rookie in his first collegiate start in over 20 years.

Following the first weekend of the regular season, Bateman leads all goalies in the UCHC and is among the top-six nationally in goals-against average (0.92) and save percentage (0.979)."
